titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph Bruchac Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday April 27, 2019 at 03:04

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Joseph Bruchac Papers contain correspondence with family, publishers, and storytelling and literary colleagues; drafts of writings, on paper and computer disks; materials concerning writing workshops taught by Bruchac in prisons; writings of others, including Native American authors; and subject files, photographs, audiocassettes, and videocassettes, many relating to storytelling performances at festivals and schools, or to Native American storytelling and literary organizations, including Returning the Gift Native American writers conferences, 1990s, and the Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers, 1990s-2000s. Research strengths include Bruchac's writings and storytelling; teaching of Abenaki and other Native American cultures; 20th-century Native American literature, children's literature, and literary organizations; and 20th-century American small presses.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Ken Lopez on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund, Danford N. Barney, Jr. Fund, Sinclair Lewis Fund, Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, and Theatre Guild Fund, 1996-2006.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 84, 99, and 145 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Joseph Bruchac Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph Bruchac Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection consists of materials formerly classed as Uncat ZA MS 510, Uncat ZA MS 571, Uncat ZA MS 603, Uncat ZA MS 619, Uncat MSS 879, and Uncat MSS 924. In 2013, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including partial rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, materials were organized into groupings by accession, and containers were renumbered in a single sequence. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the donor, while some were assigned by Library staff. Some names were updated to conform to Library of Congress name authorities; for some, see references to name forms provided by the donor were added instead. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

bioghist.head: Joseph Bruchac (1942-)
bioghist.p: Joseph Bruchac, Native American storyteller; author of novels, stories, poems, essays, and children's literature; and editor of poetry and fiction anthologies. Bruchac's storytelling and writings draw on his Abenaki ancestry and culture of Native Americans of the northeastern United States. Bruchac has been active in the Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers, and with his wife, publisher and editor Carol Bruchac, founded the Greenfield Review Literary Center and The Greenfield Review Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Joseph Bruchac Papers contain correspondence with family, publishers, and storytelling and literary colleagues; drafts of writings, on paper and computer disks; materials concerning writing workshops taught by Bruchac in prisons; writings of others, including Native American authors; and subject files, photographs, audiocassettes, and videocassettes, many relating to storytelling performances at festivals and schools, or to Native American storytelling and literary organizations, including Returning the Gift Native American writers conferences, 1990s, and the Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers, 1990s-2000s. Research strengths include Bruchac's writings and storytelling; teaching of Abenaki and other Native American cultures; 20th-century Native American literature, children's literature, and literary organizations; and 20th-century American small presses.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven groupings: November 1996 Acquisition; September 1998 Acquisition; February 1999 Acquisition; April 1999 Acquisition; July 2006 Acquisition; September 2006 Acquisition; and Other Acquisitions.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Boxes 37-40, 83, 115, and 144 (audiocassettes, videocassettes, and CD): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

controlaccess.corpname: Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: Correspondence, arranged chronologically, 1966-1995; Writings, arranged alphabetically by publisher, followed by other writings; Subject Files, arranged roughly alphabetically; and Other Papers, arranged roughly chronologically, 1970-1990s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings include materials relating to books, most published during the 1970s-1990s, and to anthologies, poems, stories, and writing workshops taught by Bruchac in prisons. Additional materials relating to writings are in the Correspondence and Subject Files series. Subject Files also contain subgroups concerning projects completed during the 1990s and to Native American storytelling. Other Papers includes files, photographs, and videocassettes relating Bruchac's writing and storytelling performances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings include materials relating to books, most published during the 1990s, followed by files relating to storytelling, translations, and writings of other Native American authors. Correspondence and Subject Files include additional materials relating to writings and storytelling performances.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Correspondence, arranged chronologically, 1994-1996; Writings, most arranged alphabetically by publisher; and Subject Files, arranged roughly alphabetically, followed by unarranged files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries of Subject Files, each arranged roughly alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials relating to Bruchac's writings and appearances; other Native American writers; Returning the Gift Native American writers conferences, 1990s; and the Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers, 1990s, including audiocassettes and videocassettes.

Canyon Records and other tape suppliers
A Day in the Life of Native America

Native writers: phone numbers and addresses

Personal log and notes for RTG

Returning the Gift. Project description and rationale
Returning the Gift. Request for support

Watson, Mary Jo; assistant to dean
Anthology (University of Arizona). Consent to publish forms
Metoxen, Kenneth Brickman. Collection of poems
Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers
Wordcraft Circle of Native Writers & Storytellers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Correspondence, arranged chronologically, most 1997-2005; Writings, arranged in three subseries, Writings by Bruchac, Writings of Other Native American Authors, and Writings of Others; and Bookings, arranged chronologically, 1990s-2000s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence contains letters from Bruchac to his parents, Joseph and Marion Bruchac, 1961-1984, followed by other correspondence, 1997-2005. Writings include materials relating to books, most published during 1990s-2000s. Bookings contains materials relating to storytelling and other appearances by Bruchac. Additional materials relating to writings and storytelling are in the Correspondence series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters from Bruchac to his parents
